name: Medical diagnostic and treatment technology
description: A field in Health concerned with the study and application of a wide range of technologies used for diagnosing and treating diseases and handicaps.

name: Ambulance technology
description: The equipment and procedures used by ambulance personnel to provide emergency medical care and transportation, a part of Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.

name: Hearing aid technology
description: The design, fitting, and maintenance of hearing aids and other assistive listening devices, within Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.

name: Medical laboratory technology
description: The performance of laboratory tests on patient samples to aid in the diagnosis, treatment, and monitoring of diseases, a key area in Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.

name: Optical technology
description: The design, manufacturing, and fitting of eyeglasses, contact lenses, and other optical devices to correct vision problems, part of Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.

name: Prosthetic technology
description: The design, fabrication, and fitting of artificial limbs (prostheses) and other assistive devices for individuals with disabilities, within Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.

name: Radiology technology
description: The use of medical imaging techniques, such as X-rays, CT scans, and MRI, to diagnose diseases and injuries, a major component of Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.

name: Radiotherapy
description: The use of ionizing radiation to treat cancer and other diseases, a specialized treatment technology within Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.

name: X-ray technology (medical)
description: The specific use of X-rays for medical imaging to diagnose various conditions, a fundamental part of Medical diagnostic and treatment technology.
